org.latency4j.configuration

Class LatencyRequirementConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.latency4j.configuration.LatencyRequirementConfiguration
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CappedRequirementConfiguration, StatisticalRequirementConfiguration

    public abstract class LatencyRequirementConfiguration
extends java.lang.Object

    Encapsulates the specification of a latency requirement.

    In addition to the fields with which requirements are initialised, this class also models two additional concepts that are crucial to latency monitoring:

    • A Persistence Manager: Each latency requirement is associated with a persistence manager which is used to persist and load durations generated in relation to said requirement.
    • Zero or more alert handlers: Ideally a latency requirement should be associated with at least one alert handler that will handle notifications generated in the course of monitoring the requirement.

      • getPersistenceManagerClass

        public java.lang.String getPersistenceManagerClass()

        Returns the name of the persistence manager implementation. Instances of this type will be used to persist durations generated as a result of monitoring the configured requirement.

        Returns:
        The name of the persistence manager implementation.

      • getAlertHandlerIds

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAlertHandlerIds()

        Returns a list containing the identifiers of the alert handlers which will process alerts generated as a result of monitoring the requirement encapsulated by an instance of this type.

        Returns:
        A list of identifiers for alert handlers to which alerts concerning this requirement will be sent.
        See Also:
        setAlertHandlerIds(List)

      • setAlertHandlerIds

        public void setAlertHandlerIds(java.util.List<java.lang.String> identfiers)

        Sets the identifiers of the alert handlers, via which all alerts generated in relation to the configured requirement will be processed.

        Note that the contents of the list must be a subset of the values returned by invoking AlertHandlerConfiguration.getAlertHandlerId() against the contents of the alert handler configuration. Put differently, all referenced handlers must be declared in the Latency4J configuration.

        Parameters:
        identfiers - The alert handler identifiers.
